item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Installation As Digital Dodgeball is a game based on the Python programming language, you are going to need a working version of Python 3. For Windows or Mac users, the easiest method is likely installing the Anaconda Distribution, which can be found here. This will get you all the needed packages and modules as well as the Spyder IDE. For Linux users, you should just be able to install Python 3 through your distribution’s package manager.

item.title: About
item.description: In the Spring of 2017 I noticed that my Mechanics class, despite homework practice and having used it in previous classes, was struggling some with basic concepts and everyday usage of Python. It felt like they were proficient in the narrow applications of what they’d done in class, but suddenly were in deep water if doing even basic things outside their comfort zone. I made Digital Dodgeball as a tentative idea in how to address that issue in an outside-of-the-classroom and fun fashion.

item.title: New Website Created!
item.description: Celebrate! This new and improved website has been created with the intention of streamlining and better explaining the logic and ideas behind Digital Dodgeball! Hopefully it serves as a better introduction to the game and as a source of ideas for new players to investigate. Useful links about getting started, documentation for the game, and ideas for bot algorithms can be found on the sidebar.
